intro: Schilleria churumayu, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to conserve moisture. Schilleria churumayu is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
